poem:
### The Puzzle of Existence

Clues, black-inked on  
newsprint—the paper's skin—  
curve their secrets.  
The unanswered waits,  
gray shadows of thought  
in dawn's chill.  
A grid of life's  
crossroads, ink-stained  
fingers trace  
paths of meaning  
between the lines,  
questioning, always  
the empty spaces.
